versos: (forbear) Ephesians 4:2 - "Be completely humble and gentle; be patient, bearing with one another in love.";;;
(innocent) Proverbs 17:15 - "Acquitting the guilty and condemning the innocent the Lord detests them both.";;;
(justify) Romans 3:24 - "and are justified by his grace as a gift, through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus,";;;
(sown) "Hear then the parable of the sower" - Matthew 13:18;;;
(provoke) Ephesians 6:4 - "Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but bring them up in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.";;;
(pardon) Psalm 130:4 - "But with you there is forgiveness, so that we can, with reverence, serve you.";;;
(edrei) Numbers 21:33 - Then they turned and went up by the way to Bashan; and Og the king of Bashan went out against them, he and all his people, to battle at edrei.;;;
(jericho) Joshua 6:26 - At that time Joshua pronounced this solemn oath: Cursed before the Lord is the one who undertakes to rebuild this city

(sickness) Jeremiah 17:16 - "As for me, I have not hurried away from being a shepherd after You, Nor have I longed for the woeful day; You know what came out of my lips; It was right there before You.";;;

(backs) Isaiah 58:14 - "Then you will find your joy in the Lord, and I will cause you to ride in triumph on the heights of the land and to feast on the inheritance of your father Jacob." For the mouth of the Lord has spoken.";;;
(basons) 2 Chronicles 4:8 - "He made also ten tables, and placed them in the temple, five on the right side, and five on the left. And he made an hundred basons of gold.";;;
(obedient) Romans 16:19 - "Everyone has heard about your obedience, so I rejoice because of you; but I want you to be wise about what is good, and innocent about what is evil.";;;
(dedan) Ezekiel 27:15 - The men of dedan were your traders; many coastlands were your own special markets; they brought you ivory tusks and ebony as payment.;
(body) Romans 12:4 - For as in one body we have many members
(nobles) Psalm 149:8 - to bind their kings with chains and their nobles with fetters of iron.;;;
(tables) Exodus 31:18 - "When the Lord finished speaking to Moses on Mount Sinai, he gave him the two tablets of the covenant law, the tablets of stone inscribed by the finger of God.";;;
(dyed) Genesis 37:31 - "Then they got Josephs robe, slaughtered a goat and dipped the robe in the blood.";;;
